Play:
The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu
(Shinpan utazaimon / 新版歌祭文)

Written By: Chikamatsu Hanji (近松半二)

First Staged: 1780

Reference: Keene, Donald, Bunraku: The Art of the Japanese Puppet Theatre (Tokyo: Kodansha International, 1973); Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); January 1993 Program; February 1971 Program

– Click image to view.

Performances:

February 1971: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

November 1974: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

April 1975: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

August 1977 Hokkaido Tour: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

April 1979: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

December 1980 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

April 1983: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

December 1984: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

January 1987: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

December 1987 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

March 1990: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

December 1990 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

May 1992: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

January 1993: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

December 1994 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

Characters:

Hisamatsu (Decchi Hisamatsu / 丁稚久松)

Kosuke (Tedai Kosuke / 手代(久三の)小助)

Sashiro Yamagaya (Yamagaya Sashirō / 山家屋佐四郎)

Fortune teller (Yamabushi Hōin / 山伏法印)

Osome (Musume Osome / 娘お染)

Oden (Gejo Oden / 下女お伝)

Kihachi (Genan Kihachi / 下男喜八)

Kanroku (Abura shibori Kanroku / 油絞り(だはの)勘六)

Yachuta (Suzuki Yachūta / 鈴木弥忠太)

Kinemon Okamura, in fact Genzo (Okamura Kinemon (jitsuwa Kishū no Genzō) / 岡村金右衛門(実は 紀州の源蔵))

Kyusaku (Oya Kyūsaku / 親久作)

Omitsu (Musume Omitsu / 娘おみつ)

Omitsu's mother (Omitsu no haha / おみつの母 )

Oyoshi (Gejo Oyoshi / 下女およし)

Okatsu (Aburaya Okatsu / 油屋お勝)

Boatman (Sendō / 船頭)

Palanquin bearer (Kagoya / 駕屋)

Ballad book seller (Saimon uri / 祭文売り(ながしの祭文))

Kyubei (Aburashibori Kyūbei / 油絞り久兵衛)

Chohachi (Aburashibori Chōhachi / 油絞り長八 )

Osatsu, a maid servant (Gejo Osatsu / 下女おさつ)

Sakino, a courtesan (Jorō Sakino / 女郎咲野 )

Proprietor of the Tanakaya tea house (Tanakaya teishu / 田中屋亭主)

Osho (Uba Oshō / 乳母お庄)
